intro: Knautia purpurea, commonly known as the purple knautia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in meadows and dry grasslands, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, serrated leaves that are dark green and slightly hairy. Knautia purpurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and attractiveness to pollinators.
